::Shadow Wing::

She tried to calm herself.  She heard what Veratis said and could 
tell that he ws uncertain about this virus of his.  "Veratis, what 
would this, virus of yours do? You said it slowly down the translife 
abillities. But what exactly does that mean?"  She could feel the 
form changing and developing into something, but what that was she 
didn't know. She cold feel the outside of the protoform, her new 
body, start to grow skin and fur.  She was very scared.  She didn't 
know what was happening or why. Her thoughts ran in a million 
directiosns at once, with fearful questions.

"Veratis, you said you didn't know what would happen if you give this 
virus to me.  What do you think would happen? I don't know what is 
ging on, but, if you htink it will help..."  she stopped and sayed a 
prayer to the matrix, which Veratis may have heard in his mind."Do 
it."
She just hoped that this was the right thing to do.




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Shadow Wings Scream echoed through Veratis' mind causing him to 
clench his
> forhead. "My dear, please don't panic" he said out loud still 
trying to
> figure out what had happened. He studied the insturments carefully 
trying to
> find the logic to the situation. The sensors showed nothing more 
than a
> normal protoform with the basic abilities of such. He could see the 
fur
> beginning to form. It had to be slowed until Lunarpine 
returned. "I'm afraid
> that theres only one alternative." He thought about the virus 
again, he
> didn't want to use it not knowing what side effects it might have 
but he
> didn't want her suffering any longer than she had to.
> 
> "I'm going to be honest with you" he said using a slow bedside 
manner voice
> He saw no reason to lie to her when she could read his mind. "I 
developed a
> type of virus that slows down translife abilities, I'd prefer not 
to use it
> but it could help you adapt, the choice is yours." he was up 
against a wall
> in this situation. Shadow Wing was confused and it seemed she was
> frightened. In a way he was frightened too. But such choices were 
best left
> to the patient, not the (Mad) scientist.
